page.title: 10O.A.P Recreation ,Liskeard
page.content: Few of the county facilities for recreation for the elderly and disabled are actually based in Liskeard.Age concern is one organization providing social gatherings,a luncheon club and transport facilities.There is also a Darby and Joan club and branch of the National Federation of O.A.P's.There are day care centres at the Pengover and Eventide Homes. Caradon Club for the Disabled and the Disabled Drivers Motor Club are in the area and the Public Library keeps tapes for the visually handicapped. The W.R.V.S provide many services such as Meals on Wheels, Books on Wheels,a clothing store,Good Companions,chiropody and a voluntary transport scheme.They have an emergency team and pay domicilliary calls.Age Concern also provide a chiropody service for the elderly.
